metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1978 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the ssl3_HandleECDHServerKeyExchangefunction in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.21, as used inMozilla Firefox before 44.0, allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice or possibly have unspecified other impact by making an SSL (1) DHEor (2) ECDHE handshake at a time of high memory consumption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1978` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.21-1ubuntu3
